26335afc-9e08-40e3-955f-e50dbaaf6d6b.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on HTML and CSS through the Coding Boot Camp. The earner understands the basics of static front-end web design using HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap. The earner is also capable of working with mobile responsive practices, media queries, and can deploy web applications.
26335afc-9e08-40e3-955f-e50dbaaf6d6b.name: HTML / CSS

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create two portfolios with responsive layouts, one using Bootstrap, and the other using media queries.
Create a full-fledged portfolio site with HTML and CSS or wireframe a portfolio site using basic CSS rules and HTML markdown.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

0fd51c0e-f399-4d2a-ad1d-6743fae63712.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on JavaScript and jQuery through the Coding Boot Camp. Utilizing the basic components and functions of JavaScript and jQuery, the earner understands how to make websites responsive to interaction, use timers, and update content. The earner is able to work with APIs, JSON and AJAX in order to update website content from an outside source. This earner has also been exposed to client-side storage and remote data management.
0fd51c0e-f399-4d2a-ad1d-6743fae63712.name: JavaScript and jQuery

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create one of two games: a game that picks a letter and the user must enter the corresponding key, or a game that selects a word and the player must guess the answer letter by letter.
Create one of two games: a game where players select the correct sequence of in-game images, or a role-playing game where players choose a character and battle with computer-controlled opponents.

Create one of two quiz applications: a single page trivia game that the player must complete before time runs out, or an application that presents questions one at a time along with timers, music, and sound effects.
Create an application that populates a web page with animated images based on user input.

Create one of two applications: an application where users can enter train station information and find out when the next train arrives, or an application where two players on separate machines can battle each other in a rock-paper-scissors game.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

14641723-d55f-40c5-b06c-06b8a4b3118e.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on SQL and NoSQL databases through the Coding Boot Camp. The earner understands how data is stored in relational and non relational databases, SQL and MongoDB. The earner is able to query and modify databases, and can connect databases to the front end to create a full stack application. The earner has created a custom ORM and learned to use existing ORMs, like Sequelize and Mongoose.
14641723-d55f-40c5-b06c-06b8a4b3118e.name: SQL and NoSQL Databases

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a series of MySQL and Node powered interfaces that mimic the operations of an online store.
Create an application using popular ORMs by using Sequelize queries, models, and associations.
Create an application that scrapes articles from a news outlet of your choice, saves the stories in a MongoDB database, and lets your application’s users save and comment on them.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

69efc570-e48e-411b-9f1d-230f5ebf97ac.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on React.js through the Coding Boot Camp. The earner is able to use the ReactJS library to create interactive user interfaces and full-stack applications by connecting ReactJS with Node.js, Express, and a MongoDB database.
69efc570-e48e-411b-9f1d-230f5ebf97ac.name: React.js

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a full-stack ReactJS application that will let users play a memory game. The game should manage component state, respond to user events, and change the user interface.
Create a React application that will let users search a MongoDB database of articles and allow users to save articles to read later.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

763559dd-8794-42ce-9272-028b9ed19ae3.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on Node.js and Express through the Coding Boot Camp. The earner has enhanced his/her JavaScript skills and can work with Node.js, a runtime environment for JavaScript. The earner has explored topics such as callbacks, class constructors, and object-oriented programming. The earner is able to use the Express framework to link the back-end and front-end of their applications to create full-stack applications.
763559dd-8794-42ce-9272-028b9ed19ae3.name: Node.js and Express

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a command line application that serves its users data from Twitter, Spotify and IMDb.com.
Create a word guessing game using JavaScript constructor functions.
Create a full-stack Express application that matches users based on the results of a personality quiz.
Create an application that lets users submit and “devour” different kinds of burgers with MySQL, Express and Handlebars.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

da55a0be-b8d8-4192-a85c-86c1981956e3.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on advanced Excel through the Data Analytics Boot Camp. The earner is able to implement statistical modeling, forecasting and prediction, pivot tables, and VBA scripting inside Microsoft Excel.
da55a0be-b8d8-4192-a85c-86c1981956e3.name: Advanced Excel

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Analyze a database using Microsoft Excel and use formulas, pivot tables, stacked column pivot charts, and pivot chart line graphs to view trends within the data.
Analyze real world data using VBA scripting that work on multiple sheets of data in Microsoft Excel.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

7336811f-d93a-4738-ba6e-5e2c911ae74c.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on Python programming through the Data Analytics Boot Camp. The earner has successfully created a Python script that analyzes numerous datasets. The earner has also demonstrated proficiency with data analytic tools like NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, and specific libraries for interacting with web data.
7336811f-d93a-4738-ba6e-5e2c911ae74c.name: Python Programming

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a Python script that analyzes financial records of a fictitious company and prints the results to the terminal as well as exports a text file with the results.
Create a Python script that analyzes poll data from multiple counties and prints the results to the terminal as well as exports a text file with the results.

Create one of two challenges: create a report using Python Pandas to analyze purchasing data from a gaming company’s fantasy game, or create a report using Python Pandas to analyze a school district’s standardized test results and showcase trends in school performance.

Create one of two challenges using Matplotlib, Pandas and Jupyter Notebook: create bubble plots and pie charts that showcase relationships between key variables and city types for a ride-sharing company, or create a scatter plot and bar graphs that show results between different treatments from a pharmaceutical company’s most recent animal study.
Create a representative model of weather across world cities using either Matplotlib or Pandas and the OpenWeatherMap API.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

70e9d2b4-ab55-44b1-ae87-7a82440f77e1.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on databases and ETL through the Data Analytics Boot Camp. The earner understands how data is stored in relational and non relational databases, SQL and MongoDB. The earner is able to query and modify databases, and organize data into well-structured and easily retrievable formats. The earner has learned the Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) process and applied it to real datasets.
70e9d2b4-ab55-44b1-ae87-7a82440f77e1.name: Databases and ETL

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create complex SQL queries that return various data from across multiple tables in a database.
Create a climate analysis using Python and SQLAlchemy for a specific set of dates, creating plots for different variables such as precipitation and temperature.
Design a Flask API based on the queries developed in the climate analysis that returns data in JSON format.

Create a production database that combines 2 or more sources of data from either databases, APIs, or web scraping, and then perform the ETL process on the data in order to populate the production database along with a technical report on the entire process performed.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

b82e5814-b5a8-42c8-b706-be4f1ad74df5.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on fundamental statistics and advanced data through the Data Analytics Boot Camp. The earner understands how to employ statistical analysis to model, predict, and forecast trends with tools such as regression analysis and linear models. The earner has been introduced to advanced data analytics topics and tools such as Tableau, R, Machine Learning and Big Data.
b82e5814-b5a8-42c8-b706-be4f1ad74df5.name: Fundamental Statistics and Advanced Data Topics

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a dashboard, story, or report with Tableau showcasing aggregate data from a public dataset, including a static map with data plotted overlaid on top or a dynamic map showing changes over time, and two unexpected phenomena in the data provided.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

58c1f242-8c8e-4b10-8440-c07823e85096.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on web visualization through the Data Analytics Boot Camp. The earner understands the core technologies of web development: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, in order to build interactive data visualizations on the web. The earner can use technologies like D3.js to build interactive web visualizations and Leaflet to perform geo-mapping.
58c1f242-8c8e-4b10-8440-c07823e85096.name: Web Visualization

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a website to host a visualization dashboard to display visualizations from a previous assignment, including various pages and a page to display the data used to build each plot.
Create a web application that scrapes other websites for data related to the Mission to Mars and displays the information in a single HTML page.
Create a web application using HTML, CSS, JavaScript and D3 that displays information from a dataset in a table that is updated dynamically based on user filters.
Create and deploy a Flask web application to Heroku that includes a dashboard page showcasing interactive charts based on a dataset.
Create a scatter plot showing data on health risks and factors of each state from two different data sources compared on multiple variables using D3.

Create a geographical visualization of earthquake data pulled from a JSON dataset using D3, including data markers, pop-ups with additional information, and an additional data set to illustrate the relationship of tectonic plates to seismic activity.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

3929423b-9346-42d2-83ce-19463042aa34.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on user experience and design thinking through the UX/UI Boot Camp. The earner has successfully applied user research, insight synthesis, prototype creation, and user testing. The earner understands the iterative process of design through a design sprint.
3929423b-9346-42d2-83ce-19463042aa34.name: User Experience and Design Thinking

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a case study of an app that uncovers and solves a real-world problem.
Create and deploy a user research plan that uncovers qualitative and quantitative data.
Create a click-through prototype that has been iterated after multiple user testing sessions.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

7297138a-e5d0-4eef-9b2c-a3fc2efcc300.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on interface design through the UX/UI Boot Camp. The earner knows the basics of design principles and how to create responsive user interfaces across mobile and desktop platforms. The earner also understands the basics of user affordance, usability, and accessibility.
7297138a-e5d0-4eef-9b2c-a3fc2efcc300.name: Interface Design

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create click-through prototypes with engaging interfaces that are tested for usability.
Create user interfaces that use grid systems that translate across mobile, tablet, and desktop platforms.
Create high fidelity wireframes with a well-defined visual hierarchy using common visual components.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

5d0b7520-3419-41a1-b322-55f272f17b62.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on visual design through the UX/UI Boot Camp. The earner has knowledge of the Gestalt principles, color theory, iconography, and typographic theory. The earner knows how to use visual design to create branding experiences for products.
5d0b7520-3419-41a1-b322-55f272f17b62.name: Visual Design

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a high fidelity style guide that demonstrates branding by displaying typography, iconography, and color palettes.
Create a case study to rebrand the user interface of an existing website.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

b05f4ea2-546f-488f-817f-2f9cb65385f2.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on the basics of front-end web design using HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap through the UX/UI Boot Camp. The earner is able to use JavaScript and jQuery to incorporate more complex user interactions into their designs.
b05f4ea2-546f-488f-817f-2f9cb65385f2.name: Web Design

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a website using HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap.
Create interactivity on a front end website using JavaScript and jQuery.
Create a website using a CMS platform.
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

af026dd7-def5-4425-9424-e5b7dcbcca11.description: The earner of this badge has an understanding of attacking and defending networks through the Cybersecurity Boot Camp. The earner has knowledge of security monitoring using Splunk and how to set up security monitoring, alerts, dashboards, and custom reports. The earner understands the Incident Response framework, and how to respond to breaches and incidents. The earner has been exposed to Forensics, the tools used to recover deleted data, and has performed 2 Red Team vs. Blue Team projects.
af026dd7-def5-4425-9424-e5b7dcbcca11.name: Defensive Security

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Use Splunk for security monitoring and logging
Use Autopsy to perform forensic analysis
Complete Red Team vs. Blue Team projects in which students will play the role of both pentester and SOC analyst
Complete all the steps of the Penetration Testing Execution Standard
Perform penetration testing on both Linux and Windows systems
Write a penetration testing report following a successful engagement
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

9415c5b2-641c-4c86-8385-e3e272bbbb92.description: The earner of this badge has mastered topics such as network configuration, design, ports, protocols, and data communication through the Cybersecurity Boot Camp. The earner has received hands-on practice analyzing data packets on the wire, investigating network security attacks and hardening, and covering a variety of topics in cryptography. The earner understands cloud virtualization and security and has completed their first projects of the program.
9415c5b2-641c-4c86-8385-e3e272bbbb92.name: Networking and Network Security

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Analyze network traffic and malicious activity using Wireshark
Use encryption, decryption, hashing, and digital signatures
Deploy a virtual Private Cloud Network protected with a firewall to the cloud
Deploy and configure ELK Stack monitoring to a virtual cloud network
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

3655bc53-690a-4435-848f-2e1bf12dbbc8.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on offensive security and penetration testing through the Cybersecurity Boot Camp. The earner has an understanding of web architecture and common web. The earner has gained a mastery of common web vulnerabilities, vulnerability scans and assessments, and penetration testing on various networks. The earner has demonstrated knowledge of the phases of penetration testing engagement and the techniques and skills involved at each step.
3655bc53-690a-4435-848f-2e1bf12dbbc8.name: Offensive Security and Penetration Testing

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Exploit common web vulnerabilities and recommend mitigation strategies
Complete all the steps of the Penetration Testing Execution Standard
Perform penetration testing on both Linux and Windows systems
Write a penetration testing report following a successful engagement
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

a2b6ff39-14a4-4b18-a554-c771d2ad60d3.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study on systems administration through the Cybersecurity Boot Camp. The earner is comfortable using the command line and has honed their systems administration skills. The earner has obtained knowledge of both Linux and Windows systems, and understands programming via both Bash and Powershell. The earner is able to configure and audit servers, and harden them from malicious attacks.
a2b6ff39-14a4-4b18-a554-c771d2ad60d3.name: Systems Administration

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Audit, secure, and harden Linux systems
Automate tasks using Bash scripting
Use basic PowerShell cmdlets to navigate Windows, manage directories and files, and retrieve Windows system event logs
Use Active Directory tools to create organizational units, users, and groups
This badge is earned through UCI Division of Continuing Education's Technology Boot Camps

e4eadca2-5e24-4ef7-8e18-2c08602ac7f5.description: The earner of this badge completed coursework and a hands-on, real-world project focused on building and leading an engineering product team. The earner demonstrated foundational command of constructing a team on skills and work style as well as managing team adversity. The earner has also demonstrated the ability to manage work performance and take corrective actions.
e4eadca2-5e24-4ef7-8e18-2c08602ac7f5.name: Building a Skill Assessed Product Team

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Perform a team skills assessment
Recruit new team members based on product needs
Manage a simulated team crisis
Generate work performance reports
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

skills.name: Building A Skill Assessed Product Team

943f3f60-33b4-44ca-a3cd-5997c907d76a.description: The earner of this badge completed coursework and a hands-on, real-world project focused on processes, techniques, and methods to design and build engineering-related products and services. The earner demonstrated foundational command of feature definition and prioritization, feasibility studies, prototyping, cost-benefit management, and change management. The earner has also demonstrated the ability to work with customers and marketers to determine value propositions and build product roadmaps.
943f3f60-33b4-44ca-a3cd-5997c907d76a.name: Data-Based Engineering Product Decision-Making

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Conduct a feature feasibility study
Organize focus groups and customer workshops
Perform product requirements validation
Create a product roadmap
Generate a prototype
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

bb9ec4b6-7cf8-473a-a776-59d729285979.description: The earner demonstrates skill in leveraging effective design practices to create engaging online learning experiences for K12, higher education, and corporate learners that drive positive outcomes. The earner has built a highly functional storyboard that utilizes active learning, gamification, and strong UX/UI principles. The storyboards will be the foundation for turning conceptual e-learning module design ideas into fully functioning learning activities, modules, courses, or curriculum.
bb9ec4b6-7cf8-473a-a776-59d729285979.name: Interactive E-Learning Storyboarding

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Build a detailed storyboard that includes all text, visual, navigation, and interactive elements for an e-learning module
Apply gamification elements to increase learner engagement
Leverage active learning principles to drive improved student outcomes
Incorporate strong visual design and navigation choices to drive learning effectiveness
Learn how to earn this badge from UCI Division of Continuing Education's E-Learning Instructional Design Certificate Program

3d282563-7a44-4af4-8e74-dcad98b02e7b.description: The earner of this badge completed coursework focused on legal research and analysis. The earner demonstrated the proper citation form for cases, statues, constitutions, and secondary authorities. The earner has also demonstrated the ability to comprehend and use computerized legal research techniques.
3d282563-7a44-4af4-8e74-dcad98b02e7b.name: Legal Research and Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Conduct comprehensive legal research utilizing primary and secondary sources
Analyze multiple legal authorities and write a comprehensive legal analysis reconciling case law with applicable statutes when appropriate
Verify and write about the reliability of cited legal authority using electronic resources
Cite legal authority in Bluebook format
Write the essential issue(s) and material facts to a given fact pattern
Learn how to earn this badge from UCI Division of Continuing Education's Paralegal Certificate Program

96fcb273-76b5-43c8-a3b2-50ecbb6cda46.description: Earners of the UCI Libraries Unix Shell badge have a basic understanding of the shell environment. They have demonstrated an ability to create a file that includes loops and shell scripts. They are able to work through the Unix Shell to combine existing programs and can use the shell to automate repetitive tasks.
96fcb273-76b5-43c8-a3b2-50ecbb6cda46.name: Unix Shell

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create executable code that demonstrates knowledge of how to navigate the shell by making new directories and files, plus code that moves files from one directory to another.
Utilize a shell script to create code using a pipe with head and tail commands, for-loops, and grep statements to analyze a text file.

Write a short response to one of two writing prompts: (1) issues you struggled with in completing the assignment and how you overcame them or (2) how using a command-line interface may help in your current or future work.
This badge is earned through the UCI Libraries Digital Scholarship Services (DSS)

e850922a-18b3-460c-bd10-d71a2af0a4c9.description: Earners of this badge have a solid foundation of course development, which is the crux of instructional design and effective online learning. The earner has demonstrated how to guide Subject Matter Experts (SME) in conceptualizing and developing course content. They have shown competency in applying the essential tools in the course development process including course maps, Learning Management System (LMS) templates, and quality reviews.
e850922a-18b3-460c-bd10-d71a2af0a4c9.name: Course Development

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Adapt a syllabus to a course map
Apply a course map to an LMS template
Appraise course quality measures and review processes

5ba480c2-4f08-497c-9415-d28687b8efdd.description: Earners completed coursework in engineering design simulation tools for solving vibration and dynamics design issues using finite element analysis software. They demonstrated skill in creating computer models using industry software tools to build an appropriate model for dynamics analysis for a variety of physical designs. They selected the relevant dynamic analysis to perform, resolved run-time issues, selected the appropriate failure criteria, and interpreted and reported the results.
5ba480c2-4f08-497c-9415-d28687b8efdd.name: Engineering Simulation: Dynamics

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create three dynamic analysis simulation models that reflect the physical behavior of a structure under dynamic loading including modal analysis, transient response, harmonic response, and can be used to improve the design
Develop, debug, and successfully run at least one dynamic analysis using Nastran & Patran
Develop, debug, and successfully run at least two dynamic analyses using SOLIDWORKS Simulation
Evaluate the results of these analyses
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

6e82f7b8-4ab7-4740-b6f9-5ab4a3b24b6c.description: Earners completed coursework in engineering design simulation tools for solving linear static structural analysis issues using finite element analysis method. The earner demonstrated skill in creating computer models using industry software tools suitable for linear static structural analysis for a variety of physical designs. The earner selected the relevant analysis to perform, resolved model issues, selected the appropriate failure criteria, and interpreted and reported the results.
6e82f7b8-4ab7-4740-b6f9-5ab4a3b24b6c.name: Engineering Simulation: Linear Static Structural Analysis

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create three linear static analysis simulation models that reflect the physical behavior of a structure and can be used to improve the design
Develop, debug, and successfully run at least two linear static analyses using SOLIDWORKS
Develop, debug, and successfully run at least one linear static analysis using Nastran and Patran
Evaluate the results of these analyses
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

skills.name: Engineering Simulation: Linear Static Structural Analysis

0fd68294-886b-4de1-acae-577998816a08.description: The earner of this badge has a solid foundation in the standard molecular biology techniques performed in biomanufacturing, pharmaceutical, and biotechnology laboratories. The earner has demonstrated industry-standard knowledge and skills in bacterial cloning, genomic and plasmid DNA isolation, PCR, restriction digest, gel electrophoresis, protein purification, and quantification, as well as experimental design and execution.
0fd68294-886b-4de1-acae-577998816a08.name: Molecular Biology Laboratory Techniques

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Molecular Biology Laboratory Techniques course
Successfully design, execute, and present a bactericidal-based experiment and score at least 80% or higher on the submitted report
Independently perform genomic and protein-based methods for determining plasmid quality and quantifying protein expression
Successfully transform and express proteins through bacterial cloning methods
Demonstrate proficiency in preparing, running, and analyzing polymerase chain reactions
This badge is earned through University Lab Partners

f0e80f78-8385-4bdb-b790-35cbf1e9ffec.description: The earner of this badge completed coursework focused on techniques to draft a contract clause. The earner demonstrated command of the fundamentals of contract drafting necessary to create a clause, which could be used in a commercial contract.
f0e80f78-8385-4bdb-b790-35cbf1e9ffec.name: Contract Clause Drafting

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Write a clause free of archaisms, problematic terms of art, and legalese
Write a clause that embodies priority-best risk mitigation to avoid contract interpretation disputes
Write in a concise manner, limiting the use of strings, elaboration, or unnecessary words
Write a clause that avoids the use of rhetorical language
Write a clause that avoids inconsistent usage that can cause unintended meaning
Learn how to earn this badge from UCI Division of Continuing Education's Paralegal Certificate Program

a4f86667-0684-4ceb-9f9f-cc834d4dae57.description: Earners completed coursework on evaluation of post-training behavior change. They demonstrated the ability to analyze and identify behaviors critical to positively impacting a targeted business goal. They evidenced the ability to analyze a work environment to detect potential obstacles to behavior change and propose mitigating solutions. They successfully developed a Level 3 Evaluation Proposal to measure behavior change and to recommend a support package to provide incentives for that change.
a4f86667-0684-4ceb-9f9f-cc834d4dae57.name: Level 3 Evaluation: Behavior Analysis Proposal

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Craft targeted level 3 evaluation goals
Accurately identify critical behaviors
Analyze potential obstacles to behavior change and propose solutions for mitigating those obstacles
Design a post-training support plan
Learn how to earn this badge from UCI Division of Continuing Education's E-Learning Instructional Design Certificate Program

7e0161cc-0064-4f43-994c-1deb188609ee.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on intermediate Excel from the Business Applications of Excel course. The earner has demonstrated the advanced techniques in charting and graphing using Microsoft Excel. The earner has also demonstrated competence in databases, advanced filters, and custom formatting.
7e0161cc-0064-4f43-994c-1deb188609ee.name: Intermediate Excel

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create two charts and tables that utilize conditional formatting, advanced filters, and custom formatting.
Create six graphs appropriate to specific variables with custom formatting from a database of data.

ce3115bd-fbb4-453e-b31f-2fe6e2422b79.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on advanced Excel from the Business Applications of Excel course. The earner has demonstrated competence in advanced functions, name ranges, pivot table enhancements, and macros using Microsoft Excel. The earner has also demonstrated ability in using auditing tools and workbooks.
ce3115bd-fbb4-453e-b31f-2fe6e2422b79.name: Advanced Excel

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create ten calculations using different formulas and functions on a data set with at least fifty rows of data while utilizing name ranges.
Create a pivot table with enhancements using at least five formatting options.

f2f25212-910f-4ce0-b653-6467fea46472.description: Earners of this badge have completed coursework and a hands-on project introducing embedded artificial intelligence and hardware, software frameworks, tools, and methods for creating embedded artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. Earners can use specialized frameworks and tools to create a machine learning model and deploy the model on resource-constrained hardware such as a low-cost microcontroller. Earners can evaluate inference performance of the deployed model.
f2f25212-910f-4ce0-b653-6467fea46472.name: Embedded Artificial Intelligence: Basics

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Capture training data from sensors
Train a machine learning model using an embedded AI development framework
Create a program to deploy the machine learning model for inference on a resource-constrained hardware device
Evaluate the inference performance of the deployed model
Learn how to earn this badge from UCI Division of Continuing Education's Developing Embedded AI Systems Specialized Studies Program

490c1b75-9453-4f50-9c3b-c2ab7cf6291c.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on beginner Excel from the Business Applications of Excel course. The earner has demonstrated the basics of spreadsheets and workbooks using Microsoft Excel. The earner has also demonstrated the basics of number, text, and cell formatting, formulas, and page setup.
490c1b75-9453-4f50-9c3b-c2ab7cf6291c.name: Beginner Excel

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create an example spreadsheet utilizing common formatting functions.
Create a set of formulas with absolute and relative references.

4083d338-0a6e-471d-86b7-922936f7fe2a.description: Earners have completed a project on design and implementation of adaptive filtering algorithms in space and time. They demonstrated command of basic MATLAB functionality and its use in designing filters that learn the properties of undesirable interference and eliminate it from sampled signals. They understand the impact and trade-offs with various adaptive filter parameters, can tailor the design for specific requirements of a given application, and understand the limitations of the algorithms.
4083d338-0a6e-471d-86b7-922936f7fe2a.name: Adaptive Filtering and Beamforming Design Using MATLAB

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Create a function in MATLAB that implements the Recursive Least Squares (RLS) Adaptive Noise Canceller
Create a function in MATLAB that implements the Least Mean Squares (LMS) Adaptive Noise Canceller
Create a function in MATLAB that implements both a time- and data-adaptive spatial filter (beamformer)
Demonstrate the ability of all the designed functions to adaptively eliminate temporally and spatially varying interference using simulated audio data
Assess the impact on performance of filter parameters such as the training length, filter length, filter step size, filter memory, and initialization using real audio data
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

skills.name: Adaptive Filtering And Beamforming Design Using MATLAB

04855645-444b-422f-af53-0648b1f61682.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on techniques to properly draft and model within Vectorworks. The earner has demonstrated command of the basics of Vectorworks operations as well as the skills to properly organize and condense files for collaboration and create a system for drafting unique to their own designer style. The earner has also demonstrated the ability to apply their knowledge to their personal theatrical discipline.
04855645-444b-422f-af53-0648b1f61682.name: Digital 2D/3D Drafting/Modeling Using Vectorworks

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Vectorworks video tutorial series and accompanying quizzes (approximately 20 hours of learning modules)
Creation of 3D models from the software’s prefabricated structures to freehand organic modeling
Creation of standardized drafting plates producing 2D drawings and renderings from 3D models
Creation of smart title block establishing individual designer brand
Specific drafting and 3D modeling techniques for theatrical scenic, lighting, sound, and projection design/construction
This badge is earned through UCI Claire Trevor School of the Arts

87383e9e-2621-4a13-9f65-5de6b3eab48d.description: The earner of this badge has a solid foundation in the fundamentals of HPLC, proper instrument set up, and sample preparation and analysis. The earner has demonstrated proficiency in solubilizing pharmaceuticals, creating quantitative concentration curves, and preparing samples from complex biological mixtures.
87383e9e-2621-4a13-9f65-5de6b3eab48d.name: HPLC Analysis of Pharmaceuticals & Biologics

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the basics in HPLC analysis course work through University Lab Partners
Independently solubilize and dilute a pharmaceutical for HPLC analysis
Independently precipitate, extract, and dilute a complex biological mixture for HPLC analysis
Successfully perform HPLC analysis of a complex biological mixture
This badge is earned through University Lab Partners

6c698e39-9ce0-4395-ab73-9961793fc0ce.description: The earner of this badge has completed a course of study focused on basic techniques in McNeel Rhinoceros (Rhino) 6.0. The earner has demonstrated command of the Rhino operations necessary to generate simple three-dimensional computer models. The earner has also demonstrated the ability to translate these three-dimensional models into drawings, renderings, and files suitable for 3D-printing.
6c698e39-9ce0-4395-ab73-9961793fc0ce.name: Basic Rhinoceros 6.0

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Using Rhinoceros 6.0, create an accurate three-dimensional model of an object
Create a set of dimensioned orthographic drawings of the object
Create a rendering of the object
Create a 3D-printable file of the object
This badge is earned through UCI Claire Trevor School of the Arts

18c7fc5d-b9e8-49e3-84ed-8112880713c2.description: Earners of this badge completed coursework focused on designing a telecentric lens (TCL) with demonstrated usage of TCL’s properties. The earner completed the design tasks of machine vision system from initial steps to final version including tolerancing, while meeting all specifications.
18c7fc5d-b9e8-49e3-84ed-8112880713c2.name: Telecentric Lens: Machine Vision System Design

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Apply core concepts of TCL
Design TCL using Zemax OpticStudio
Meet specifications for diffraction limited system performance
Perform sensitivity/inverse sensitivity analysis and Monte-Carlo analysis
Learn how to earn this badge from UCI Division of Continuing Education's Optical Engineering or Optical Instrument Design Certificate Program.

skills.name: Telecentric Lens: Machine Vision System Design

adcd0d0e-7b00-4a47-abf2-7cb62594e709.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to analyze, design, and evaluate a micro-implantable device for interfacing with the nervous system. They can analyze the biocompatibility issues, examine the various design constraints, develop viable microfabrication approaches, and evaluate the effectiveness of the design.
adcd0d0e-7b00-4a47-abf2-7cb62594e709.name: Design of Microimplants

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Analyze the biocompatibility of cochlear, retinal, and neural implants
Design a micro-implantable device for a targeted site in the nervous system
Develop a microfabrication process to construct the device
Evaluate the effectiveness of the design against existing practices
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

3c6da73f-41b7-4c13-92c4-52c8b97eba42.description: The earner of this badge has a solid foundation in the fundamental principles of flow cytometry (sample preparation, experimental controls). The earner has demonstrated proficient skills in designing, executing, and analyzing a multicolor panel experiment using best practices in analytic cytometry, experiment design and analysis.
3c6da73f-41b7-4c13-92c4-52c8b97eba42.name: Advanced Flow Cytometry

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete Basics of Flow Cytometry and Advanced Flow Cytometry courses through University Lab Partners
Independently determine and create a flow cytometry workspace and gating strategy
Independently determine and set up proper instrument settings for selected panel
Independently acquire and analyze flow cytometry data
This badge is earned through University Lab Partners

9d2e2e57-c87c-4fd4-8291-7b986fdb71a0.description: The earner has completed a course of study on light plot and paperwork creation, along with personalized graphic styled layouts of all pertinent information created within Vectorworks Spotlight, Lightwright, MS Office, and Adobe Acrobat. They have demonstrated command of advanced 2D light plot drafting, 3D lighting sectioning techniques in Vectorworks and a command of theatrical industry standard paperwork software, Lightwright. They have competency of file and program organizational techniques.
9d2e2e57-c87c-4fd4-8291-7b986fdb71a0.name: Lighting Graphics

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Vectorworks Spotlight video tutorial series and accompanying quizzes (approximately 8 hours of learning modules)
Complete 3D lighting sectioning on a large‐scale theatrical production
Complete 2D drafted light plot adhering to industry standards and personal graphic layout for same large‐scale theatrical production
Complete a full range of paperwork for the same large scale theatrical production
Creation and use of smart title block establishing individual designer brand
Use of MS Office products to create accompanying paperwork, such as cue sheets, shop orders and submittal lists
Use of Adobe Acrobat to create a combined PDF Package of information listed above
This badge is earned through UCI Claire Trevor School of the Arts

8ee03150-6735-41fb-9458-cc80384b1902.description: The earner of this badge completed coursework focused on techniques to design and lay out a textile design using Photoshop CC. The earner demonstrated command of the basics of Photoshop CC operations necessary to create an original design, color reduce, and format a file to be sent to a textile printer. The earner has also demonstrated the ability to create designs and models for repeats and engineered designs.
8ee03150-6735-41fb-9458-cc80384b1902.name: Digital Textile Design Using Photoshop CC

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Use Photoshop CC to create an original textile design or recreate a historical design
Create a color reduced, indexed file suitable for digital printing with a vendor
Create and proof a repeating motif
Assess the parameters for engineered textile design
Create an engineered textile design
This badge is earned through UCI Claire Trevor School of the Arts

skills.name: Digital Textile Design Using Photoshop CC

590b9192-fe92-4da7-a057-757552d6fcbb.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to build, test and evaluate a machine learning model on a large dataset. They can import a dataset into R, set up AutoML using H2O, and evaluate the effectiveness of the model produced.
590b9192-fe92-4da7-a057-757552d6fcbb.name: Model Design for Machine Learning

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Import a dataset (greater than 1 MB) into R
Clean and format the dataset
Specify and run an H2O AutoML model
Evaluate the effectiveness of the model
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

212e36bd-df42-4639-9ed3-b3fef2db888b.description: The earner of this badge has a solid foundation of the fundamental principles of mammalian cell culture and aseptic techniques. The earner has demonstrated proficient skills in aseptic technique, essential cell culture techniques (seeding, passaging, counting, cryopreservation), media formulation, microscopic evaluation of confluence, morphology, contamination identification and prevention, and viability and growth curve calculations.
212e36bd-df42-4639-9ed3-b3fef2db888b.name: Fundamental of Cell Culture

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Fundamentals of Mammalian Cell Culture course through University Lab Partners
Independently expand and maintain one cell lines without loss of morphology
Demonstrate proficiency in aseptic techniques, media preparation, and imaging
Successfully execute a cell-based experiment
This badge is earned through University Lab Partners

dd3cd8d9-2bb7-48f6-9952-2baf19187add.description: The earner of this badge completed coursework focused on techniques to draft a commercial contract clause. The earner demonstrated command of the fundamentals of commercial contract drafting necessary to create a clause, which could be used in a commercial contract.
dd3cd8d9-2bb7-48f6-9952-2baf19187add.name: Commercial Contract Clause Drafting

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Write a clause that has clarity and omits archaisms, problematic terms of art, and non-standard use of English
Write a clause that is precise and omits legalese
Write a clause that avoids redundancy and repetition in the form of omitting the use of strings, elaboration, or unnecessary words
Write a clause that avoids the use of rhetorical language
Write a clause that omits having unintended meaning attributed to inconsistent usages

583e5922-e8b2-4de1-8fec-7dbb06ca1b8b.description: The earner of this badge has a solid foundation in GLP standards found in biomanufacturing, pharmaceutical, and biotechnology laboratories. The earner used molecular biology techniques to validate a recombinant plasmid. The earner demonstrated proficient skills in protein quantification, plasmid isolation, bacterial cloning, and data analysis.
583e5922-e8b2-4de1-8fec-7dbb06ca1b8b.name: Basics of Recombinant Plasmids

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Basics of Recombinant Plasmid course through University Lab Partners
Demonstrate proficiency in bacterial cloning, plasmid isolation, and protein quantification
Independently maintain a laboratory notebook using standard formatting
Successfully analyze and present experimental results
This badge is earned through University Lab Partners

be34efa8-2717-4abd-86f0-b0d624cf3a6e.description: The earner of this badge completed coursework focused on techniques to draft a contract clause amendment. The earner demonstrated command of drafting the amendment related to the post-award phase and accompanying best practices.
be34efa8-2717-4abd-86f0-b0d624cf3a6e.name: Contract Amendment Clause Drafting

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Write a clause that clearly ties to the post-award phase
Write a clause that demonstrates understanding of contract risk management

Write a clause that demonstrates superior grasp of commercial or government contract principles and distinguishes between amending and supplementing; as well as adding, deleting, and replacing language
Learn how to earn this badge from UCI Division of Continuing Education’s Contract Management Certificate Program

635a1695-d4c6-4796-9187-db062f1a1f0f.description: Earners have a fundamental understanding of engineering design simulation tools and can use finite element analysis software. They demonstrated proficient skills in creating computer models using CAD software suitable for analysis and choosing appropriate element types (beam, plate, solid) for a variety of physical designs. They can select the relevant analysis type(s) to perform, resolve run-time issues, select the appropriate failure criteria, and interpret and report results of the analysis.
635a1695-d4c6-4796-9187-db062f1a1f0f.name: Engineering Design Simulation Basics

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Engineering Simulation Tools and Techniques Webinar Series
Create two simulation models that can be used to accurately model the physical behavior of the structure
Develop at least two analysis pathways for these designs
Successfully debug and run two analyses appropriate for these designs
Create a short report with the results of these analyses and scoring at least 80%
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

953ec89c-486f-46a8-bf89-ad3b17824161.description: Earners have a fundamental understanding of mammalian cell culture techniques, GLP standards, working procedures in a tissue culture facility, and can perform basic cell-based research experiments. They demonstrated proficient skills in aseptic technique, essential cell culture techniques (seeding, passaging, thawing, cryopreservation), cell-line expansion and maintenance, proper cell culture documentation, media formulation, contamination identification and prevention, and immunocytochemistry.
953ec89c-486f-46a8-bf89-ad3b17824161.name: Mammalian Cell Culture Techniques

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Mammalian Cell Culture Techniques course
Successfully design, execute, and present on a cell-based experiment and score at least 80% or higher on the submitted report
Independently maintain, store, and establish multiple cell lines
Maintain a professional industry-standard laboratory notebook
Create standard operating procedures (SOP) for laboratory equipment and operation
This badge is earned through University Lab Partners

1d67d49e-fd31-4f7c-a0d4-488ce6fa4fe1.description: Earners of this badge have completed a course of study focused on intermediate level skills using SQL (Structured Query Language). Utilizing the intermediate components of SQL, the earner understands how to develop a new database using SQL, load external data into a newly created database, and apply DML and DDL for data manipulation techniques. They are also able to create an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD) to outline relationships within a database structure.
1d67d49e-fd31-4f7c-a0d4-488ce6fa4fe1.name: SQL Intermediate: Data Manipulation & Database Creation Using SQL

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate correct application of DML (Data Manipulation Language) and DDL (Data Definition Language) to insert, update, and delete data within multiple databases
Create an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD) for a new SQL database that includes all table and column names and provides clear and concise relationships between each database structure
Outline, develop, and create a new SQL database with proper table relationships, columns, and correct database scripts
Appropriately modify datatypes within a newly created SQL database for practical and appropriate use of data within each column
Apply DML and DDL to import external data into a newly created database using SQL
Learn how to earn this badge from UCI Division of Continuing Education's Database Management Certificate Program

skills.name: SQL Intermediate: Data Manipulation & Database Creation Using SQL

cbab198a-9426-4afe-afad-0eee5de00ed8.description: Earners of this badge have an understanding of the practical skills related to starting a company. Earners demonstrated they can translate market research and customer feedback into a functional business model, product/service, and more complete description of their company. They have shown competency in the following skill areas: financial statements, ratios and projections, relationship between core business segments, and product-market-fit.
cbab198a-9426-4afe-afad-0eee5de00ed8.name: Startup Company: Formation

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Business Model Canvas - Create a one-page Business Model Canvas populating each of the nine (9) blocks of the canvas with at least three (3) bullet points appropriate to each block.

Develop a Minimum Viable Product, that is, a physical and virtual mockup, prototype, or other tool by which you can learn the most important insights from your customer, for the least cost, in the shortest amount of time.
Craft pro forma financial statements covering the next 3 years, including Income Statement, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Statement.

770a8380-55c2-405a-89c5-2443062850f9.description: Earners of this badge have an understanding of the practical skills related to starting a company. Earners demonstrated they know, understand and can communicate their value proposition to their employees, customers, suppliers and funders sufficiently to build a growing company. They have shown competency in the following skill areas: critical thinking, market research, and customer discovery.
770a8380-55c2-405a-89c5-2443062850f9.name: Startup Company: Foundation

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Elevator Pitch - Compose a 100-word written explanation of your Company: your name and title or role, the company’s name, your personal motivation/story, the problem being solved, the product or service solution, your one main competitive advantage, a description of the typical customer, the potential number of customers, your unit price, your Revenue and Net Profit targets for next year.

Competitive Analysis – Compose a table comparing at least five (5) of your features/benefits/traits to at least three (3) of your highest priority competitors, identifying where you features/benefits/traits are superior, neutral, or inferior to the competition, with notes explaining/characterizing each ranking.

Customer Survey – Develop and secure actionable feedback in at least five (5) areas such as preferred features and benefits, preferred price, etc. from a survey of at least twenty (20) of your typical customers.

3550f6ab-0c24-46ef-87a2-ee0e41a15b3d.description: Earners of this badge have an understanding of the practical skills related to starting a company. Earners demonstrated they understand and can communicate their business sufficiently to craft pro forma financial statements and a business pitch deck, and attract funding. They have shown competency in the following skill areas: effective presentation/communication, strategic thinking, and investor pitching.
3550f6ab-0c24-46ef-87a2-ee0e41a15b3d.name: Startup Company: Funding

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Compose a one (1) page Executive Summary that briefly explains your company, the problem/need/want being addressed; product or service; customers; suppliers; competition; risks and opportunities; revenue and net profit for the next 3 years; funds sought for what percentage equity; anticipated 5-year Return-on-Investment.
Craft a business pitch deck per the requirements of the funding entity.
Deliver your pitch presentation to an institutional competition, or a government or institutional grant program, securing at least $20,000 USD from the competition/grant entity.

522fe3a2-71a7-4d79-be75-3bcc13c93323.description: The earner of this badge completed coursework focused on user design for digital health technology and created a prototype. The prototype can be a sensor user interface or an app. The design pays attention to key factors including user needs, metrics of engagement and retention, and figures of merit. The competency requires creating a design, prototype, and iterative user testing.
522fe3a2-71a7-4d79-be75-3bcc13c93323.name: User Design for Digital Health Technology

issuer.summary: issued by University of California, Irvine

badge_template_activities.title: Determine key factors needed for effective design, engagement, and retention
Prototype the design / user Interface / app
Test the design with potential users
Iterate on the design
Quantify improvements on design based on iterations
This badge is earned through UCI Samueli School of Engineering’s Master of Engineering program

skills.name: User Design For Digital Health Technology
